name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Ohio research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Ohio ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Ohio ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Ohio research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Ohio research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Ohio Research Tips and Strategies
    AR—Finding Ohio Ancestors

  2. Get an overview of Ohio research in these videos.

    ☆ FS—Ohio Overview—6:04
    ☆ AAC—Researching Your Ohio Ancestors—54:53 (account required)

  3. Follow this research study for Ohio ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Ohio Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Ohio research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Ohio Resources
    ☆ AC—Ohio State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Ohio Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Ohio Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Case Studies
    1. Follow these case studies for Ohio research.

      ☆ LDS—Discovering the Family of a Woman Living in Ohio
      ☆ LDS—Finding a woman's family who had moved from Ohio to Australia

    2. Here is a case study about finding parents for an adopted child.

      ☆ LDS—Finding the parents of an adopted child born in the 1870s in Ohio

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Ohio in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Ohio
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Ohio Minorities

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Ohio African American Records
      ☆ African American Genealogy Resources

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Ohio.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Ohio in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Ohio
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Ohio archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Ohio archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Ohio archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Ohio Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Ohio State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Learn how to find Ohio archive records in this video.

    ☆ AAC—Major Repositories: Places You'll Want to Look for Your Ancestors—7:24

  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Ohio.
  4. Explore Ohio History Connection family history links.
  5. Explore the Ohio Memory Project.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Ohio genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Ohio research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Ohio ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Ohio city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Ohio Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Ohio city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Ohio city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Ohio ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Ohio city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about Ohio vital and census records.

hidden.summary:
• Find online resources for vital records.
  • Learn the history of vital records in the state of Ohio.
  • Learn about alternates for vital records in Ohio.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Ohio vital records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Ohio Vital Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Ohio Vital Records

  2. Explore links for vital records on the Ohio Public Health site.
  3. Search for online Ohio ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  4. Explore Ohio birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Ohio vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site and the Genealogy Branches site.

• Find research clues in the Library of Congress historical newspaper collection.
  • Search Ohio online newspaper sites.

text:

  2. Find links to Ohio newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Ohio Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore Ohio newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. See additional Ohio newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  6. Explore additional links for Ohio newspapers and obituaries records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Ohio research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Ohio County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Ohio.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Ohio Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Ohio research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Ohio Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Ohio Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Ohio.
Regional/Local Societies

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Ohio research.
  2. Explore the Ohio research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Ohio research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Ohio research.
  5. Explore Ohio research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Ohio in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Ohio Societies

  2. Explore the Ohio Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore Ohio genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Ohio.
